1984-01-17.lead_paragraph: McGregor Inc., a clothing marketer owned by the Rapid-American Corporation, yesterday entered the bidding for Faberge Inc., the fragrance and shampoo maker, offering almost $180 million against an earlier bidder's $169 million. The previous bid, made on Jan. 6, came from an investment group organized by Gibbons Green Amerongen Ltd., a New York private investment banking concern.

1984-01-17.snippet: The British Petroleum Company, the first foreign oil company to drill for oil in China, said today that it had started a second well exploring the Pearl River Basin of the South China Sea. British Petroleum announced a week ago that its first offs...
1984-01-17.lead_paragraph: The British Petroleum Company, the first foreign oil company to drill for oil in China, said today that it had started a second well exploring the Pearl River Basin of the South China Sea. British Petroleum announced a week ago that its first offshore well had struck oil, but that not enough ahd been found to be worth exploiting and the well was abandoned.

1984-01-24.snippet: Texaco Inc. settled litigation yesterday with all the heirs of J. Paul Getty in a major step toward completing its takeover of the Getty Oil Company.     In the settlement, Texaco increased its offer for Getty Oil by $237 million, to $10.1 billion...
1984-01-24.lead_paragraph: Texaco Inc. settled litigation yesterday with all the heirs of J. Paul Getty in a major step toward completing its takeover of the Getty Oil Company. In the settlement, Texaco increased its offer for Getty Oil by $237 million, to $10.1 billion, the company announced last night. The terms were accepted by the heirs, Texaco said, and then approved by Judge Richard Byrne of Superior Court in Los Angeles.
